description.plain: Ingrid Michaelson (born December 8, 1979) is an American, New York-based indie pop singer-songwriter. Her first album Slow the Rain was released in 2005 and since then she has released five more albums: Girls and Boys, Be OK, Everybody, Human Again, and Lights Out. Her two highest charting singles are “The Way I Am” and “Girls Chase Boys” at No. 37 and No. 52 on the Billboard Hot 100, respectively.

body.plain: Ingrid Michaelson (born December 8, 1979) is an American, New York-based indie pop singer-songwriter. Her first album Slow the Rain was released in 2005 and since then she has released five more albums: Girls and Boys, Be OK, Everybody, Human Again, and Lights Out. Her two highest charting singles are “The Way I Am” and “Girls Chase Boys” at No. 37 and No. 52 on the Billboard Hot 100, respectively.

songs.full_title: The Way I Am by Ingrid Michaelson
songs.title: The Way I Am

description.plain:
“The Way I Am” is a hit song by Ingrid Michaelson from her album Girls and Boys.
The lyrics describe an enduring love that forgives the other’s idiosyncracies and embraces them as things that make him unique. All she wants in return is to be loved and accepted the same way.

songs.lyrics:
18 ContributorsThe Way I Am Lyrics[Verse 1]
If you were falling
Then I would catch you
You need a light
I'd find a match

[Chorus]
'Cause I love the way you say good morning
And you take me the way I am

[Verse 2]
If you are chilly
Here, take my sweater
Your head is aching
I'll make it better

[Chorus]
'Cause I love the way you call me baby
And you take me the way I am

[Verse 3]
I'd buy you Rogaine
When you start losing all your hair
Sew on patches
To all you tear
You might also like[Chorus]
'Cause I love you more than I could ever promise
And you take me the way I am
You take me the way I am
You take me the way I am13Embed

songs.full_title: You and I by Ingrid Michaelson (Ft. Dan Romer)
songs.title: You and I

description.plain:
“You and I” features on Ingrid Michaelson’s 2008 compilation album Be OK. It’s one of Michaelson’s most popular outputs, trailing only “Girls Chase Boys” as far as Spotify plays.

The song is short, breezy, light-hearted, and supported—until the final playing of its chorus—by nothing more than a ukulele. Appropriately so for the song’s title, the song is something of a duet: on the studio version Michaelson sings the first verse and the first chorus, while her producer Dan Romer takes of verse 2 all except the second and last lines. The two join forces for the final two choruses—accompanied only by ukulele for the former, but bolstered also by what sound like claps and feet-stomps for the latter. There are several live versions available on YouTube where Jason Mraz, and sometimes others, take on the male part. Here and here and here and here.

songs.embed_content: Read “You and I” by Ingrid Michaelson on Genius

songs.full_title: Girls Chase Boys by Ingrid Michaelson
songs.title: Girls Chase Boys

description.plain:
The instantly refreshing “Girls Chase Boys” served as the lead single off Michaelson’s sixth album Lights Out. Optimistic and bright, Michaelson’s track regards the blurring of gender roles and sexuality in romantic relationships.  Per Logo, she wrote:

More than just being about my experience, its focus shifted to include the idea that, no matter who or how we love, we are all the same. The video takes that idea one step further, and attempts to turn stereotypical gender roles on their head. Girls don’t exclusively chase boys. We all know this. We all chase each other and in the end we are all chasing after the same thing: love.

The single’s accompanying music video fit well with the lyrical content: an homage to Robert Palmer’s iconic “Simply Irresistible” and “Addicted to Love” music videos, the film displays a collection of men and women all wearing intense makeup and slicked back hair. Warped gender roles are very apparent, and Michaelson – a woman – becomes the center of attention while men become the background dancers.

songs.embed_content: Read “Girls Chase Boys” by Ingrid Michaelson on Genius
songs.recording_location: St. Cecilia's in Tucson AZ, The Trophy Room in Nashville TN
